page.title: 13BOTTLE MAKING AT KNOTTINGLEY
page.content: One 8th of Britains glass bottles are made in Knottingley.Raw materials are{sand,lime}&{soda ash}.The lime was to be had locally,and coal for the furnaces.Sand now comes by barge,lorry or train.Lime & soda ash by road or rail.Gas or oil are now the fuel 1700 people work in the 3 works,Gregg & Co and Rockware's Bagley and Headlands Works.Business has been hit by the new {plastic bottles.}The Rockware works are quite big.But Greggs are just a local company. Rockware make bottles for milk wine whiskey and pop.The factories look very dominating with their tall chimneys.{"Gobs"}of molten glass({"metal"})are blown into shape in iron moulds. Fuel can be saved by recycling rejects & glass from bottle banks-"cullet"to the bottle-makers. Other local firms make the cast-iron moulds or help deliver bottles.
